value.title: Manage repository changes by using pull requests on GitHub
value.excerpt: Learn how to manage changes to your repository source by using pull requests.

value.title: Manage an InnerSource program by using GitHub
value.excerpt: Learn to manage a successful InnerSource program on GitHub through effective discoverability, guidance, and maintenance.

value.title: Perform Zero ETL analytics with HDInsight Interactive Query
value.excerpt: Perform Zero ETL analytics with HDInsight Interactive Query

value.title: Prepare on-premises workloads for migration to Azure
value.excerpt: Prepare on-premises workloads for migration to Azure

value.title: Protect your identities with Azure AD Identity Protection
value.excerpt: Use the advanced detection and remediation of identity-based threats to protect your Azure Active Directory identities and applications from compromise.

value.title: Azure Data Fundamentals: Explore modern data warehouse analytics in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn the fundamentals of database concepts in a cloud environment, get basic skilling in cloud data services, and build your foundational knowledge of cloud data services within Microsoft Azure. You will explore the processing options available for building data analytics solutions in Azure. You will explore Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks, and Azure HDInsight.

topItems.title: Examine components of a modern data warehouse
topItems.excerpt: Examine components of a modern data warehouse

topItems.title: Explore data storage and processing in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Explore data storage and processing in Azure

value.title: Run Azure for SAP workloads
value.excerpt: This learning path augments existing knowledge around the deployment methodologies for SAP workloads in Azure, focusing on Azure Marketplace and custom images using the Azure portal, Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates, and Azure PowerShell cmdlets.

value.title: Authenticate apps to Azure services by using service principals and managed identities for Azure resources
value.excerpt: Securely authenticate apps to Azure to manage and access Azure services. Service principals and managed identities give your app an Azure AD identity.

value.title: Interactively debug Node.js apps with the built-in and Visual Studio Code debuggers
value.excerpt: Learn how to efficiently debug your Node.js app by using Visual Studio Code to fix your bugs quickly.

value.title: Explore data ingestion in Azure
value.excerpt: Explore data ingestion in Azure

value.title: Implement Azure VM-based SAP solutions
value.excerpt: Implement Azure VM-based SAP solutions

value.title: Introduction to open-source database migration on Azure
value.excerpt: "Introduction to open-source database migration on Azure"

value.title: Maintain a secure repository by using GitHub best practices
value.excerpt: Learn best practices for building, hosting, and maintaining a secure repository on GitHub.

value.title: Create and deploy a cloud-native ASP.NET Core microservice
value.excerpt: This module guides you through containerizing an ASP.NET Core microservice and deploying it to Azure Kubernetes Service.

value.title: Migrate SAP workloads to Azure
value.excerpt: Migrate SAP workloads to Azure

value.title: Monitor data drift with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Changing trends in data over time can reduce the accuracy of the predictions made by a model. Monitoring for this data drift is an important way to ensure your model continues to predict accurately.

value.title: Core Cloud Services - Set up CORS for your website and storage assets
value.excerpt: Set up Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) for your Azure website and storage assets in order to allow cross-domain access to your resources.

value.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks

value.title: Securely connect IoT devices to the cloud
value.excerpt: Interested in building end to end IoT solutions or about Azure IoT, but aren't quite sure what it can do for you? This path is the place to start.

topItems.title: Learn how to manage IoT devices as an IT admin
topItems.excerpt: This module is an introduction to the Internet of Things for IT admins.

topItems.title: Automatically provision IoT devices securely and at scale with the Device Provisioning Service
topItems.excerpt: The focus of this module is on creating a Device Provisioning Service (DPS) to securely handle multiple remote devices. First, you create an IoT Hub, and add the DPS service. Next, an X.509 root certificate, and multiple leaf certificates, are created to handle security. Code for a simulated device is provided. You then link all the pieces together, and verify that your DPS resource works. After completing the module, you should have a good understanding of how to provision Azure IoT devices at scale.

topItems.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure IoT Hub message routing, and Stream Analytics anomaly detection. Start by creating an app that simulates issues with conveyor belt vibration. Then, use the Azure portal to route all the data for archiving in blob storage. Finish by routing the vibration data to anomaly detection, using a built-in ML model.

topItems.title: Remotely monitor and control devices with Azure IoT Hub
topItems.excerpt: Create an IoT Hub device app, and a back-end service app. As a scenario, we use the monitoring, and controlling, of the temperature and humidity of a cheese cave.

value.title: Threat Modeling Security Fundamentals
value.excerpt: This learning path takes you through the four main phases of threat modeling, explains the differences between each data-flow diagram element, walks you through the threat modeling framework, recommends different tools and gives you a step-by-step guide on creating proper data-flow diagrams.

topItems.title: Introduction to threat modeling
topItems.excerpt: Explore the four high-level steps of threat modeling.

topItems.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
topItems.excerpt: Data-flow diagrams are graphical representations of your system and should specify each element, their interactions and context.

topItems.title: Provide context with the right depth layer
topItems.excerpt: Threat models can get complex if all parties involved cannot agree on a data-flow diagram depth layer that provides enough context to satisfy requirements

topItems.title: Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
topItems.excerpt: Threat modeling is an effective technique to help you identify threats and ways to reduce or eliminate risk. We start by deciding to focus on either what needs to be protected or who it needs protection from.

value.title: Introduction to Azure SQL
value.excerpt: This module introduces Azure SQL. Learn about various deployment options and service tiers and what to use for your organization.

value.title: Scale your cloud resources with elasticity
value.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Discover what cloud elasticity means and different ways to scale your cloud resources.

value.title: Create an app to run parallel compute jobs in Azure Batch
value.excerpt: Learn to use the Azure Batch platform to write a .NET Core console app that performs parallel, large-scale, high-performance video transcoding.

value.title: Deploy batch inference pipelines with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Machine learning models are often used to generate predictions from large numbers of observations in a batch process. To accomplish this, you can use Azure Machine Learning to publish a batch inference pipeline.

value.title: Explain machine learning models with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Many decisions made by organizations and automated systems today are based on predictions made by machine learning models. It's increasingly important to be able to understand the factors that influence the predictions models make.

value.title: Automate development tasks by using GitHub Actions
value.excerpt: Create a basic GitHub Action and use that action in a workflow.

value.title: Application types in Microsoft identity
value.excerpt: Learn how developers can leverage Microsoft identity in different types of applications.

value.title: Manage IoT Central applications with the REST API
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to manage an IoT Central application programmatically using the REST API

value.title: Migrate your repository by using GitHub best practices
value.excerpt: Learn to move your existing project to GitHub from a legacy version control system.

value.title: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure SQL Databases
value.excerpt: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure SQL Databases
